title: The Youngest WAAAF in the service
creator_contributor_role: Victoria. Dept. of Planning and Community Development, partner
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.

abstract: Everything was new and exciting. It was my first foray into the wider world.
description: For Jean Williamson, her time at the Women's Auxiliary Australian Airforce was new and exciting and, much to her disappointment, short. She joined a few months shy of the end of the war. Still, as she looks back through an album of memories, she reflects fondly on friends made, good times and meeting her husband Noel. She also considers how at that time she wasn't aware she was an Indigenous Australian. When she found out, she responded by becoming heavily involved in the Indigenous community. Despite her pale complexion, Jean Williamson proudly declares her black heart.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2001839; In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [Indigenous veterans]; Active; 2010
